tournament.name: Hunter Burton Memorial - HBMO24 - GenX Comics and Games 5k

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly bring out Arclight Phoenix by filling the graveyard with spells, utilizing cards like Opt, Consider, and Sleight of Hand. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster also help fill the graveyard while disrupting the opponent's game plan. Fiery Impulse, Lightning Axe, and Torch the Tower provide removal options for threats. Treasure Cruise and Temporal Trespass allow for card advantage and potentially pulling Phoenix back from the graveyard. The deck also includes some counter spells with Spell Pierce and Prismari Command for protection.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It also utilizes powerful threats like Hullbreaker Horror and Shark Typhoon to close out the game. The mana base includes utility lands and a mix of both white and blue sources to support a variety of spells. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while setting up card advantage engines like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Memory Deluge to pull ahead in the late game.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and powerful creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Graveyard Trespasser, the deck aims to strip the opponent of resources while establishing a board presence with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gifted Aetherborn. The deck also has a strong late-game with cards like The End and Liliana of the Veil to grind out the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Amalia Benavides Aguirre and various creatures to generate a large amount of life gain and value. The key is to use cards like Fauna Shaman and Chord of Calling to search for combo pieces, while utilizing cards like Collected Company and Return to the Ranks to bring back creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Voice of Resurgence and Skyclave Apparition for disruption and protection. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency in executing the strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with Dimir Rogues, utilizing a mix of disruptive spells and evasive creatures to quickly pressure the opponent's life total. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief fill the graveyard quickly, enabling support from cards like Drown in the Loch and Into the Story. The deck includes a selection of removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats, while powerful finishers like Nighthawk Scavenger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse can quickly close out games. The deck aims to control the board and win the game through efficient aggression.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful life-gain combo using cards like Amalia Benavides Aguirre, Chord of Calling, and Collected Company. By assembling the right pieces, the player can quickly gain a large amount of life and potentially win the game with Aetherflux Reservoir. In addition, the deck includes various creatures that support the combo and provide flexibility in different situations. The key strategy is to efficiently search for and play the necessary cards to set up the combo while maintaining board presence and protection.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and combo off. It includes ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands, as well as untap effects like Hidden Strings and Archdruid's Charm to maximize the efficiency of Lotus Field. The deck also includes key finishers like Omniscience and Emergent Ultimatum to quickly close out games once the combo is assembled. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently ramping into powerful spells and overwhelming the opponent with high impact plays.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spirits to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With cards like Mausoleum Wanderer, Spell Queller, and Supreme Phantom, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily increasing its own threat level. Smuggler's Copter provides additional card draw and evasion, while cards like No More Lies and Get Lost offer disruption and tempo advantage. Cemetery Illuminator and The Wandering Emperor provide late-game power to finish off the opponent. The deck's mana base includes lands that support the spirit tribal theme and provide flexibility in casting spells.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to heavily control the board through countering spells, removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. It includes a variety of spells for card draw and manipulation, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to provide additional card advantage and control options. Additionally, the deck includes a combination of board wipes and creature generation to maintain control over the battlefield. The mana base is structured to support the control elements of the deck and ensure consistency in casting spells.
